channel.title: Well
channel.description:
Well, this year in my lovely High School I have decided to take a class called CAD, which stands for Computer Aided Design. I know this is a 3D modeling class, but has anyone ever had this class before?
If so, can you tell me what type of objects they shall be making/rendering in CAD? I know the program in our school; we use Autodesk 3D MAX. But, I don't know what we would be making, I was thinking like something very easy such as furniture; nothing really complex.
So yeah.. :P

item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

fucking lucky i wish we had that class.
[/quote]
so you could make more blue fucking night vision?[/quote]
Haha, you realize blue is thermal right? So they are used.

item.title: Well
item.dc:creator: @soul_raever soul raever
item.description:
@soul_raever wrote:

when i used CAD… i was doing engineering drawings
which is 3 different views of something in 2d from those 3 drawings you get enough information to be able to manufacture it :)… that was utter crap

Read full topic

item.title: Well
item.dc:creator: @grantbm grantbm
item.description:
@grantbm wrote:

The computer aided design class at my school makes models of homes and after you finish the 3D home you are able to make what design what ever you like and be graded on it.

item.title: Well
item.dc:creator: @bloodrayne bloodrayne
item.description:
@bloodrayne wrote:

In my freshman year, we were making cars in AutoCAD, also starting to play with Maya and other Autodesk programs. 3 years later and I’ve come to like it, I’ve also been told I can take some certification test and get paid uber amounts of money for making models.

Read full topic

item.title: Well
item.dc:creator: @Xx_R_A_G_3_R Xx R A G 3 R
item.description:
@Xx_R_A_G_3_R wrote:

Oo. This sounds like a class I took called CADD (Computer Aided Drafting and Design). From the way you talk though it seems more like IED (Into to Engineering and Design) In my CADD class we did 3 views of an object then drew the 3D model using a program known as AutoCAD. I am currently taking IED but I can tell you that in IED you do more work with 3D models then I did in CADD.

Read full topic

item.title: Well
item.dc:creator: @xpatx xpatx
item.description:
@xpatx wrote:

[quote=“frank_, post:10, topic:297622”]i took a similar subject at highschool, i enjoyed it. it is basically technical drawing/modelling (we also did board work)

we used pro/desktop but they were teaching autodesk to the grade behind us

the most complex models we made were as assignments, a chess board + pieces and a fishing reel (i dont have the models of either and only a screenshot of the chessboard)
[/quote]

Oh then this class will hopefully be at fun.

Read full topic

item.title: Well
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“Cowie`, post:9, topic:297622”][quote author=xpatx link=topic=394017.msg2929413#msg2929413 date=1251176924]
Well, I believe CAD - computer aided design which is technically 3D modeling.
[/quote]

CAD is moar.[/quote]
cowie is right, CAD can be 2D as well as 3D you will do any design work that is computer based and will probably be similar to frank_'s description

Read full topic

item.title: Well
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

CAD is fun If you really get into it and enjoy it, look into obtaining a copy of AutoCAD. As for the class, I have never taken one on CAD, but learned quite a bit about it from my dad who works with it daily. They probably will have you making things you have no interest though. I suggest messing around with it for fun whenever you get a chance.

Read full topic

item.title: Well

item.description:

item.title: Well
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

Well I took 3 years of 3D modelling and animation in highschool. The first year we learned sketchup, wings3d, and maya. With maya we made tanks, castles, some other crap, but not really any animation.

My last year our teacher gave us a list of 100 different things we could do, and told us to hand in 3 of them by the end of the year. Best class ever.

Read full topic

item.title: Well
item.dc:creator: @xpatx xpatx
item.description:
@xpatx wrote:

Oh fantastic. This is my future career, making teapots on a 3D modeling program…how great.
